sentences.text: The 2017 Annual Meeting of Shareholders of Genuine Parts Company, a Georgia corporation, will be held at the Companys headquarters, 2999 Wildwood Parkway, Atlanta, Georgia, on Monday, the 24  day of April 2017, at 10:00 a.m., for the following purposes: th

sentences.text: (1)  To elect as directors the eleven nominees named in the attached proxy statement;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (2)  To approve, by a non-binding advisory vote, the compensation of the Companys executive officers;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (3)   To recommend, by a non-binding advisory vote, the frequency of the advisory vote on the compensation of th ompanys executive officers;

sentences.text: (4)  To ratify the selection of Ernst & Young LLP as the Companys independent auditors for the fiscal year ending December 31, 2017; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (5)  To act upon such other matters as may properly come before the meeting or any reconvened meeting following any adjournment thereof.

sentences.text: ANNUAL MEETING  APRIL 24, 2017
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This proxy statement is being furnished to the shareholders of Genuine Parts Company in connection with the solicitation of proxies by the Board of Directors of the Company for use at the Companys 2017 Annual Meeting of Shareholders to be held on Monday, April 24, 2017, at 10:00 a.m. local time and at any reconvened meeting following any adjournment thereof.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Annual Meeting will be held at the Companys headquarters, 2999 Wildwood Parkway, Atlanta, Georgia.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This proxy statement and the accompanying proxy card are first being mailed to shareholders and made available on our website on or about February 27, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Companys 2016 annual report to the shareholders, including consolidated financial statements for the year ended December 31, 2016, is enclosed.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: VOTING
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholders of record can simplify their voting and reduce the Companys costs by voting their shares via telephone or the Internet.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Instructions for voting via telephone or the Internet are set forth on the enclosed proxy card.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The telephone and Internet voting procedures are designed to authenticate votes cast by use of a personal identification number.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These procedures enable shareholders to appoint a proxy to vote their shares and to confirm that their instructions have been properly recorded.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If your shares are held in the name of a bank or broker (in street name), the availability of telephone and Internet voting will depend on the voting processes of the applicable bank or broker; therefore, it is recommended that you follow the voting instructions on the form you receive from your bank or broker.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you do not choose to vote by telephone or the Internet, please mark your choices on the enclosed proxy card and then date, sign and return the proxy card at your earliest opportunity.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All proxies properly voted by telephone or the Internet and all properly executed written proxy cards that are delivered to the Company (and not later revoked) will be voted in accordance with instructions given in the proxy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: When voting on the election of directors, you may (1) vote FOR all nominees listed in this proxy statement, (2) WITHHOLD AUTHORITY to vote for all nominees, or (3) WITHHOLD AUTHORITY to vote for one or more nominees but vote FOR the other nominees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: When voting on the approval of the Companys executive compensation program and the ratification of the selection of independent auditors, you may vote FOR or AGAINST the proposal or you may ABSTAIN from voting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: When voting on the frequency of advisory vote on executive compensation, you may recommend that a vote should occur (1) EVERY YEAR, (2) EVERY TWO YEARS, (3) EVERY THREE YEARS, or (4) you may ABSTAIN from voting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If a signed proxy card is received which does not specify a vote or an abstention, the shares represented by that proxy card will be voted FOR all nominees to the Board of Directors listed in this proxy statement, FOR the proposal to approve the Companys executive compensation program, for an advisory vote on executive compensation to occur EVERY YEAR, and FOR the ratification of the selection of independent auditors for the fiscal year ending December 31, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company is not aware, as of the date hereof, of any matters to be voted upon at the Annual Meeting other than those stated in this proxy statement and the accompanying Notice of 2017 Annual Meeting of Shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If any other matters are properly brought before the Annual Meeting, the enclosed proxy card gives discretionary authority to the persons named as proxies to vote the shares represented thereby in their discretion.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you hold your shares in street name and you do not instruct your bank or brokerage firm in accordance with their directions how to vote your shares prior to the date of the Annual Meeting, your bank or brokerage firm cannot vote your shares (referred to as broker non-votes) on the following proposals: Proposal 1  Election of Directors, Proposal 2  Advisory Vote on Executive Compensation, or Proposal 3  Advisory Vote on Frequency of Advisory Shareholder Vote on Executive Compensation, and such shares will be considered broker non-votes and will not affect the outcome of these votes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, your bank or brokerage firm may vote your shares in its discretion on Proposal 4  Ratification of Selection of Independent Auditors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A shareholder of record who submits a proxy pursuant to this solicitation may revoke it at any time prior to its exercise at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Such revocation may be by delivery of written notice to the Corporate Secretary of the Company at the Companys address shown above, by delivery of a proxy bearing a later date
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (including a later vote by telephone or the Internet), or by voting in person at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Street name holders may revoke their proxies prior to the Annual Meeting by following the procedures specified by their bank or brokerage firm.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Only holders of record of the Companys Common Stock at the close of business on the record date for the Annual Meeting, which is February 14, 2017, are entitled to vote at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Persons who hold shares of Common Stock in street name as of the record date may vote at the Annual Meeting only if they hold a valid proxy from their bank or brokerage firm.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the close of business on February 14, 2017, the Company had outstanding and entitled to vote at the Annual Meeting 148,378,606 shares of Common Stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On each proposal presented for a vote at the Annual Meeting, each shareholder is entitled to one vote per share of Common Stock held as of the record date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A quorum for the purposes of all matters to be voted on shall consist of shareholders representing, in person or by proxy, a majority of the outstanding shares of Common Stock entitled to vote at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shares represented at the Annual Meeting that are abstained or withheld from voting and broker non-votes will be considered present for purposes of determining a quorum at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If less than a majority of the outstanding shares of Common Stock are represented at the Annual Meeting, a majority of the shares so represented may adjourn the Annual Meeting to another date, time or place.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The vote required for (1) the election of directors, (2) the advisory vote on executive compensation, and (3) the ratification of the selection of independent auditors is the affirmative vote of a majority of the shares of Common Stock outstanding and entitled to vote on such proposal which are represented at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Because votes withheld and abstentions will be considered as present and entitled to vote at the Annual Meeting but will not be voted for these proposals, they will have the same effect as votes against these proposals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The vote required to determine the frequency of advisory shareholder vote on executive compensation is a plurality of votes cast, which means that the frequency option that receives the most affirmative votes of all the votes cast is the one that will be deemed approved by the shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Abstentions will not affect the outcome of this proposal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although the advisory vote on executive compensation and the frequency of the advisory vote on executive compensation are non-binding as provided by law, the Companys Board of Directors will review the results of the votes and take them into account in making future determinations concerning executive compensation and the frequency of the advisory vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PROPOSAL 1
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ELECTION OF DIRECTORS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors of the Company currently consists of thirteen directorships.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Dr. Mary B. Bullock and Mr. Gary W. Rollins have reached mandatory retirement age for the Board and therefore will not stand for re-election at the 2017 Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors has approved the recommendation of its Compensation, Nominating and Governance Committee to decrease the number of directorships to eleven as of the date of the 2017 Annual Meeting and has nominated the eleven nominees named below to serve as directors until the 2018 Annual Meeting and the election and qualification of their successors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the event that any nominee is unable to serve (which is not anticipated), the Board of Directors may:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: designate a substitute nominee, in which case the persons designated as proxies will cast votes for the election of such substitute nominee;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: allow the vacancy to remain open until a suitable candidate is located and nominated; or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: adopt a resolution to decrease the authorized number of directorships.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If any incumbent director nominee in an uncontested election should fail to receive the required affirmative vote of the holders of a majority of the shares entitled to vote which are represented at the Annual Meeting, under Georgia law, the director remains in office as a holdover director until his or her successor is elected and qualified or until his or her earlier resignation, retirement, disqualification, removal from office or death.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: event of a holdover director, the Board of Directors in its discretion may request the director to resign from the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the director resigns, the Board of Directors may:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: immediately fill the resulting vacancy;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: allow the vacancy to remain open until a suitable candidate is located and appointed; o
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: adopt a resolution to decrease the authorized number of directorships.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS UNANIMOUSLY RECOMMENDS THAT SHAREHOLDERS VOTE FOR THE ELECTION OF ALL OF THE NOMINEES.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Set forth below is certain information about each of the eleven nominees for director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For additional information about the nominees, including the experience, qualifications, attributes and skills that our Board believes makes them well qualified to serve as directors, as well as information about our director independence requirements, our director nominating process, our board leadership structure, and other corporate governance matters, see Corporate Governance below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: NOMINEES FOR DIRECTOR
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Name, Principal Occupation, Certain Other Current and Past Directorships and Age
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Elizabeth W. Camp is President and Chief Executive Officer of DF Management, Inc., a private investment and commercial real estate management company, a position she has held since 2000.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Previously, Ms. Camp served in various capacities, including President and Chief Executive Officer of Camp Oil Company for 16 years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ms. Camp serves as a director of Synovus Financial Corp. and has chaired both its Compensation and Audit Committees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ms. Camp is 65.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Paul D. Donahue is President and Chief Executive Officer of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In May of 2016, he was named Chief Executive Officer and was named President of the Company in January of 2012.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He served as President of the Companys U.S. Automotive Parts Group from July, 2009 to February 1, 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Donahue served as Executive Vice President of the Company from August 2007 until his appointment as President.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, between 2004 and June 2007, Mr. Donahue served as President and Chief Operating Officer of S. P. Richards Company, a wholly-owned subsidiary of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Donahue is 60.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Gary P. Fayard was Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer of the Coca-Cola Company from 2003 until his retirement in May, 2014.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Fayard joined the Coca-Cola Company in 1994 as Vice President and Controller.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He was promoted to the role of Senior Vice President and Chief Financial Officer in 1999.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He has served as Director on numerous for-profit and not-for-profit boards, including service on the Coca-Cola Enterprises, Inc. board from 2001 until 2009, service on the Coca-Cola FEMSA board from 2003 to 2016, and currently serves on the board of directors of Monster Beverage Corporation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Fayard is 64.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Thomas C. Gallagher is Executive Chairman of the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He has served as Chairman since February 2005 and served as Chief Executive Officer of the Company from August 2004 to May of 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Gallagher served as President of the Company from 1990 until January 2012 and Chief Operating Officer of the Company from 1990 until August 2004.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Gallagher serves on the board of Oxford Industries, Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Gallagher is 69.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: John R. Holder is Chairman and Chief Executive Officer of Holder Properties, a commercial and residential real estate development, leasing, and management company based in Atlanta.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Holder has held the position of Chairman since 1989 and Chief Executive Officer since 1980.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He is also a director of Oxford Industries, Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Holder is 62.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: John D. Johns is Chairman and Chief Executive Officer of Protective Life Corporation in Birmingham, Alabama, a wholly owned subsidiary of The Dai-ichi Life Insurance Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Johns served as Chief Executive Officer of Protective Life Corporation since January 2002 and became Chairman in January 2003.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He served as President and Chief Operating Officer of Protective Life from August 1996 through December 2001, and from October 1993 through August 1996 he served as Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Johns also serves as a director of Regions Financial Corporation and The Southern Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He is formerly a director of Alabama Power Company, a wholly owned subsidiary of The Southern Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Johns is 65.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Robert C. Robin Loudermilk, Jr. is President and Chief Executive Officer of The Loudermilk Companies, LLC, a real estate management company, a position he has held since January 1, 2012.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Previously he served as President of Aarons Inc., a furniture, electronics and home appliance retailer from 1997 through November 2011 and as Chief Executive Officer of Aarons Inc. from 2008 through November 2011.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He also served in various other positions at Aarons Inc., beginning as an Assistant Store Manager in 1985 and including service as the Chief Operating Officer from 1997 until 2008.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Loudermilk also previously served as a director of Aarons Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Loudermilk is 57.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Wendy B. Needham was Managing Director, Global Automotive Research for Credit Suisse First Boston, an investment
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Jenrette from 1994 to 2000.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ms. Needham previously served as a director of Asahi Tec.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ms. Needham is 64.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Jerry W. Nix served as the Vice Chairman of the Board of Directors from November 2005 until his retirement as CFO in March, 2013.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He served as Chief Financial Officer of the Company from 2000 to 2013.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Previously, Mr. Nix held the position of Executive Vice President-Finance from February 2000 until November 2005 and Senior Vice President- Finance from 1990 through 1999.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Nix currently serves as a director on the board of Synovus Financial Corp.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Nix is 71.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: E. Jenner Wood, III was Corporate Executive Vice President of SunTrust Banks, Inc. until his retirement in December of 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He was Chairman, President and Chief Executive Officer of the Atlanta Division of SunTrust Bank from April, 2014 to October, 2015 and served as a Corporate Executive Vice President of SunTrust Banks, Inc. from 2005 through his retirement in December of 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Wood served as Chairman, President and Chief Executive Officer of the Georgia/North Florida Division of SunTrust Bank from 2013 through March 2014 and as Chairman, President and Chief Executive Officer of the Atlanta/Georgia Division of SunTrust Bank from 2010 to 2013.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Wood previously served as President, Chairman and Chief Executive Officer of SunTrust Bank Group from 2002 to 2010.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Wood is a member of the Board of Directors of The Southern Company and also serves as a director of Oxford Industries.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Wood previously served as a director of Georgia Power Company until his election to the Board of Directors of that entitys parent company, The Southern Company, in 2012.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Wood is also a past member of the Board of Crawford & Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Wood is 65.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: CORPORATE GOVERNANCE
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Independent Directors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Companys Common Stock is listed on the New York Stock Exchange.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The NYSE requires that a majority of the directors, and all of the members of certain committees of the board of directors be independent directors, as defined in the NYSE corporate governance standards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Generally, a director does not qualify as an independent director if the director (or in some cases, members of the directors immediate family) has, or in the past three years has had, certain material relationships or affiliations with the Company, its external or internal auditors, or other companies that do business with the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board has affirmatively determined that ten of the Companys thirteen current directors and eight of the eleven director nominees have no other direct or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: indirect relationships with the Company and therefore are independent directors according to the NYSE corporate governance standards and an analysis of all facts specific to each director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. E. Jenner Wood, a Director of the Company since August 17, 2014 retired on December 31, 2016 as Corporate Executive Vice President of SunTrust Banks, Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During 2016, the Company continued its long-standing banking relationship with SunTrust, and used the Banks services in the general course of business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This banking relationship was reviewed and considered by the Board and the Compensation, Nominating, and Governance Committee in determining the independence of Mr. Wood.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The amount of payments made and received by SunTrust and the Company represented an immaterial percentage of the Companys and SunTrusts revenues.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board and Compensation, Nominating, and Governance Committee believe that the relationship during 2016 was non- preferential and that Mr. Wood did not personally participate in or benefit from this relationship, leading to the conclusion that the relationship was not material and to a determination that Mr. Wood is independent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The independent directors and nominees are: Mary B. Bullock, Elizabeth W. Camp, Gary P. Fayard, John R. Holder, Donna W. Hyland, John D. Johns, Robert C. Robin Loudermilk, Wendy B. Needham, Gary W. Rollins and E. Jenner Wood.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Effective as of the date of the Annual Meeting, Dr. Bullock and Mr. Rollins will retire as directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Corporate Governance Guidelines
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors has adopted Corporate Governance Guidelines that give effect to the NYSEs requirements related to corporate governance and various other corporate governance matters.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Companys Corporate Governance Guidelines, as well as the charters of the Compensation, Nominating and Governance Committee and the Audit Committee, are available on the Companys website at www.genpt.com.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Non-Management Director Meetings and Presiding Independent Director
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pursuant to the Companys Corporate Governance Guidelines, the Companys non-management directors meet separately from the other directors in regularly scheduled executive sessions at least annually and at such other times as may be scheduled by the Chairman of the Board or by the presiding independent director or as may be requested by any non-management director.

sentences.text: Board Leadership Structure
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Upon the Boards appointment of Paul Donahue as both President and Chief Executive Officer of the Company, the Board appointed the Companys former Chief Executive Officer and Chairman to continue to serve as Executive Chairman of the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In his recent position as CEO, Mr. Gallagher had primary responsibility for the day-to-day operations of the Company; as Executive Chairman, he continues to provide leadership on the Companys key strategic objectives as well as set strategic priorities for the Board (with input from the presiding independent director), preside over its meetings, and communicate strategic findings and guidance to management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board believes that this leadership structure is currently the most effective structure for the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As noted earlier, the independent directors have appointed a presiding independent director, which provides balance to the Boards structure.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With a supermajority of independent directors, an Audit Committee and a Compensation, Nominating and Governance Committee each comprised entirely of independent directors, and a presiding independent director to oversee all meetings of the non-management directors, the Companys Board
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director Nominating Process
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholders may recommend a director nominee by writing to the Corporate Secretary specifying the nominees name and the other required information as set forth in the Companys By-laws.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The By-laws require, among other things, that the shareholder making the nomination: (1) notify us in writing no later than the close of business on the 90  day and no earlier than the close of business on the 120  day prior to the first anniversary of the date of the Companys notice of annual meeting sent to shareholders in connection with the previous years annual meeting; (2) include certain information about the nominee, including his or her name, occupation and Company share ownership; (3) include certain information about the shareholder proponent and the beneficial owner, if any on whose behalf the nomination is made, including such person or entitys name, address, Company share ownership and certain other information regarding the relationship between the shareholder and beneficial owner, if applicable, and any derivative or hedging positions in Company securities; and (4) update the required information as of the record date and after any subsequent change.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The notice must comply with all requirements of the By-laws and, if the nomination is to be included in next years proxy statement, the requirements of SEC Rule 14a-8 and must be timely received by the Corporate Secretary at Genuine Parts Company, 2999 Wildwood Parkway, Atlanta, Georgia 30339.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: th th

sentences.text: The Companys Board of Directors has established the following process for the identification and selection of candidates for director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation, Nominating and Governance Committee, in consultation with the Chairman of the Board, annually reviews the appropriate experience, skills and characteristics required of Board members in the context of the current membership of the Board to determine whether the Board would better be enhanced by the addition of one or more directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This review includes, among other relevant factors in the context of the perceived needs of the Board at that time, issues of experience, reputation, judgment, diversity and skills.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With regard to diversity, the Board and the Compensation, Nominating and Governance Committee believe that sound governance of the Company in an increasingly complex international marketplace requires a wide range of viewpoints.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a result, although the Board does not have a formal policy regarding Board diversity, the Board and the Committee believe that the Board should be comprised of a well-balanced group of individuals with diverse backgrounds, educations, experiences and skills that contribute to board diversity, and the Compensation, Nominating and Governance Committee considers such factors when reviewing potential candidates.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the Compensation, Nominating and Governance Committee determines that adding a new director is advisable, the Committee initiates a search, working with other directors, management and, if it deems appropriate or necessary, a search firm retained to assist in the search.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation, Nominating and Governance Committee considers all appropriate candidates proposed by management, directors and shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Information regarding potential candidates is presented to the Compensation, Nominating and Governance Committee, and the Committee evaluates the candidates based on the needs of the Board at that time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Potential candidates are evaluated according to the same criteria, regardless of whether the candidate was recommended by shareholders, the Compensation, Nominating and Governance Committee, another director, Company management, a search firm or another third party.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation, Nominating and Governance Committee then submits any recommended candidate(s) to the full Board of Directors for approval and recommendation to the shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Companys Board of Directors is comprised of individuals with diverse experience at policy-making levels in a variety of businesses, as well as in education and non-profit organizations, in areas that are relevant to the Companys activities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each director was nominated on the basis of the unique experience, qualifications, attributes and skills that he or she brings to the Board, as well as how those factors blend with those of the others on the Board as a whole.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On an individual basis:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: company.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual Performance Evaluations
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Companys Corporate Governance Guidelines provide that the Board of Directors shall conduct an annual evaluation to determine, among other matters, whether the Board and the Committees are functioning effectively.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee and the Compensation, Nominating and Governance Committee are also required to each conduct an annual self-evaluation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation, Nominating and Governance Committee is responsible for overseeing this self-evaluation process.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board, Audit Committee and Compensation, Nominating and Governance Committee each conducted an annual self-evaluation process during 2016 and feedback from the process was reported to and discussed by the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board Oversight of Risk
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Companys Board of Directors recognizes that, although risk management is primarily the responsibility of the Companys management team, the Board plays a critical role in the oversight of risk.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board believes that an important part of its responsibilities is to assess the major risks the Company faces and review the Companys options for monitoring and controlling these risks.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board assumes responsibility for the Companys overall risk assessment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board as a whole examines specific business risks in its regular reviews of the individual business units and also on a Company-wide basis as part of its regular strategic reviews.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to periodic reports from two committees (discussed below) about risks, the Board receives presentations throughout the year from various
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: business units that include discussion of significant risks specific to such business unit as necessary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Periodically, at Board meetings, management discusses matters of particular importance or concern, including any significant areas of risk requiring Board attention.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee has specific responsibility for oversight of risks associated with financial accounting and audits, as well as internal control over financial reporting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee monitors and reviews applicable enterprise risks identified as part of the Companys enterprise risk management program, including the Companys risk assessment and management policies, the Companys major financial risk exposure and the steps taken by management to monitor and mitigate such exposure.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation, Nominating and Governance Committee oversees the risks relating to the Companys compensation policies and practices as well as management development and leadership succession in the Companys various business units.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation, Nominating and Governance Committee annually reviews with management the design and operation of the Companys incentive compensation arrangements for all employees, including executive officers, for the purpose of determining whether such programs might encourage inappropriate risk-taking that could have a material adverse effect on the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In advance of such review, the Company identifies internal and external factors that comprise the Companys primary business risks, and management compiles an inventory of incentive compensation arrangements, which are then summarized for the Compensation, Nominating and Governance Committee and reviewed for the purpose of identifying any aspects of such programs that might encourage behaviors that could exacerbate the identified business risks.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In conducting this assessment for 2016, the Compensation, Nominating and Governance Committee considered the performance objectives and target levels used in connection with these incentive awards and also the features of the Companys compensation program that are designed to mitigate compensation-related risk.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on such assessment, the Compensation, Nominating and Governance Committee concluded that the Companys compensation policies and practices for its employees are not reasonably likely to have a material adverse effect on the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Code of Conduct and Ethics
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors has adopted a Code of Conduct and Ethics for Employees, Contract and/or Temporary Workers, Officers and Directors and a Code of Conduct and Ethics for Senior Financial Officers, both of which are available on the Companys website at www.genpt.com.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These Codes of Conduct and Ethics comply with NYSE and Securities and Exchange Commission (the SEC) requirements, including procedures for the confidential, anonymous submission by employees or others of any complaints or concerns about the Company or its accounting, internal accounting controls or auditing matters.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company will post any amendments to or waivers from the Code of Conduct and Ethics (to the extent applicable to the Companys executive officers and directors) on its website.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Audit Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committees main role is to assist the Board of Directors with oversight of (1) the integrity of the Companys financial statements, (2) the Companys compliance with legal and regulatory requirements, (3) the independent auditors qualifications and independence and (4) the performance of the Companys internal audit function and independent auditors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As part of its duties, the Audit Committee assists in the oversight of
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) managements assessment of, and reporting on, the effectiveness of internal control over financial reporting,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) the independent auditors integrated audit, which includes expressing an opinion on the conformity of the Companys audited financial statements with United States generally accepted accounting principles,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (c) the independent auditors audit of the Companys internal control over financial reporting which includes expressing an opinion on the effectiveness of the Companys internal control over financial reporting and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (d) the Companys risk assessment and risk management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (See Board Oversight of Risk above.)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee oversees the Companys accounting and financial reporting process and has the authority and responsibility for the appointment, retention and oversight of the Companys independent auditors, including pre- approval of all audit and non-audit services to be performed by the independent auditors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee annually reviews and approves the firm to be engaged as independent auditors for the Company for the next fiscal year, reviews with the independent auditors the plan and results of the audit engagement, reviews the scope and results of the Companys procedures for internal auditing and monitors the design and maintenance of the Companys internal accounting controls.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee Report appears later in this proxy statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A current copy of the written charter of the Audit Committee is available on the Companys website at www.genpt.com.

sentences.text: Compensation, Nominating and Governance Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation, Nominating and Governance Committee is responsible for (1) determining and evaluating the compensation of the Chief Executive Officer and other executive officers and key employees and approving and monitoring our executive compensation plans, policies, and programs, (2) identifying and evaluating potential nominees for election to the Board and recommending candidates for consideration by the Board and shareholders, (3) developing and recommending to the Board a set of Corporate Governance Guidelines, as well as periodically reevaluating those Corporate Governance Guidelines, and (4) overseeing the evaluation of the Board of Directors and management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee also periodically reviews and evaluates the risk involved in the Companys compensation policies and practices and the relationship of such policies and practices to the Companys overall risk and management of that risk.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee has and may exercise the authority of the Board of Directors as specified by the Board and to the extent permitted under the Georgia Business Corporation Code, and the Committee has the authority to delegate its duties and responsibilities to subcommittees as it deems necessary and advisable.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A brief description of the Committees policy regarding director candidates nominated by shareholders appears in Director Nominating Process above, and a full version can be found in the Companys By-Laws.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For 2016, the Committee independently retained a compensation consultant, Meridian Compensation Partners, LLC, to assist it in its review of executive compensation practices, including the competitiveness of pay levels, design issues, market trends and technical considerations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During the year, Meridian assisted the Committee with the development of competitive market data for executives and a related assessment of the Companys executive compensation levels, a risk assessment of the Companys incentive compensation, and also provided legislative and regulatory updates and guidance regarding reporting of executive compensation under the SECs proxy disclosure rules.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Both our Executive Chairman and our Chief Executive Officer, with input from our Senior Vice PresidentHuman Resources and Meridian, recommended to the Committee base salary, target bonus levels, actual bonus payouts and long-term incentive grants for our senior executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee considered, discussed, modified as appropriate, and took action on such proposals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee has agreed that Meridian will play a similar role for 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation, Nominating and Governance Committee annually considers whether the work of any compensation consultant raised any conflict of interest.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For 2016, the Committee considered various factors, including the six factors mandated by SEC rules, and determined that with respect to executive and director compensation-related matters, no conflict of interest was raised by the work of Meridian.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee also considers the six independence factors mandated by SEC rules before engaging any other compensation advisers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The current members of the Compensation, Nominating and Governance Committee are John D. Johns (Chair), John R. Holder, Gary W. Rollins and E. Jenner Wood.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: COMPENSATION DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In this section, an overview and analysis is provided of our executive compensation programs and policies, the material compensation decisions we have made under those programs and policies, and the material factors that we considered in making those decisions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Later in this proxy statement under the heading Additional Information Regarding Executive Compensation you will find a series of tables containing specific information about the compensation earned or paid in 2016 to the following individuals, who are referred to as our named executive officers:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Thomas C. Gallagher, Executive Chairman
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Paul D. Donahue, President & Chief Executive Officer
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Carol B. Yancey, Executive Vice President & Chief Financial Officer
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Timothy P. Breen, President & Chief Executive Officer  Motion Industries
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Lee A. Maher, President  U.S. Automotive Parts Group
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: James R. Neill, Senior Vice President  Human Resources
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The discussion below is intended to explain the detailed information provided in those tables and put that information into context within the Companys overall compensation program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016 In Brief
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During 2016, the Compensation, Nominating and Governance Committee actions and our pay-for-performance program operated such that compensation actually earned by executives reflected the performance of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Highlights for 2016 are as follows:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our total shareholder return for 2016 was 14.3%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This served to increase both shareholder wealth and the value of equity awards previously granted to our executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Revenues were up 0.4% and were 98% of our target; pre-tax earnings were down 4.4% and were 94% of our target.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Plan Payouts
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a result of the above and other performance results, 2016 bonus payouts and earning of performance-based restricted stock units were generally below target.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016 annual incentive awards for Messrs. Gallagher, Donahue and Neill and Ms. Yancey were 100% of the total target amount, based on the Companys 2016 pre-tax profit of $1,074,340,000, or 94% of the target amount, and a working capital improvement of 12%, which was 150% of the target amount.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Breens 2016 annual incentive award was 61% of total target.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This award was partly earned based on the Industrial Products Groups pre-tax profit performance, which was at 90% of target.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Breens annual incentive award is also based on the Industrial Products Groups sales performance, which was 96% of target.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additional goals for the Industrial Products Group pertaining to inventory turnover and working capital were partially met.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Mahers 2016 annual incentive award was 42% of total target.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This award was partly earned based on the Automotive Parts Groups pre-tax profit performance, which was 86% of target.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Mahers annual incentive award is also based on the Automotive Groups sales which was 94% of target.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accounts receivable and inventory turnover performance goals were partially met.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The performance-based restricted stock units granted in 2016 were earned at 72% of target for Messrs. Gallagher, Donahue and Neill and Ms. Yancey, at 52% of target for Mr. Breen, and at 0% target for Mr. Maher for performance during 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Such earned shares generally vest based on four additional years of continued employment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016 Pay Opportunities
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any 2016 base salary increases higher than 3-4% and any increases in 2016 target bonus percentage were made in order to recognize promotions into new roles or meaningful gaps to market levels.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Long-term incentive awards (stock appreciation rights, or SARs, and performance-based restricted stock units, or PRSUs) were granted to our executive officers in 2016 at similar levels relative to prior year grants, below the size-adjusted 50th percentile of the market data.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PRSU payouts were dependent on achievement of corporate performance goals relating to pre-tax profit for 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SARs deliver value to executive officers only to the extent our stock price increases after the grant date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Best Practices
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe our compensation programs reflect a best practices approach to pay and governance:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our double trigger change-in-control severance arrangements with the named executive officers do not provide for any excise tax gross ups.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have no employment contracts or guaranteed severance arrangements with named executive officers other than ou double-trigger change in control agreements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Grants of long-term incentives are subject to double-trigger vesting upon a change in control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We target pay opportunities for base salary, target bonus and long-term incentives as a group at or below the size-adjusted 50th percentile of the market data.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: About 70% of our CEOs compensation is performance-based and performance-based compensation represents between 61% and 77% of compensation for each of the other named executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our stock ownership guidelines result in our executives being long-term holders of our stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Annual Incentive Plan contains a clawback provision
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have no tax gross-ups for perquisites or benefits other than relocation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have never re-priced stock options or stock appreciation rights.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We pay dividend equivalents on performance-based restricted stock units only to the extent such units are earned through performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our insider trading policy prohibits transactions in publicly traded options and other hedging transactions with respect to Company common stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Consideration of Last Years Advisory Shareholder Vote on Executive Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the 2016 Annual Meeting of Shareholders, approximately 97% of the shares present and entitled to vote were cast in support of the compensation of the Companys executive officers, as discussed and disclosed in the 2016 Proxy Statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In light of the strong shareholder support of the compensation paid to our executive officers evidenced by the results of this advisory vote, the Board and the Committee did not make any specific changes to our executive compensation program for 2016 in response to the vote, other than adding a working capital metric to the Annual Incentive Program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Future advisory votes on executive compensation will serve as an additional tool to guide the Board and the Committee in evaluating the alignment of the Companys executive compensation program with the interests of the Company and its shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Philosophy and Objectives
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our overall goal in compensating executive officers is to attract, retain and motivate key executives of superior ability who are critical to our future success.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that short-term and long-term incentive compensation opportunities provided to executive officers should be directly aligned with our performance, and our compensation is structured to ensure that a significant portion of executives compensation opportunities is directly related to achievement of financial and operational goals and other factors that impact shareholder value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our compensation decisions with respect to executive officer salaries, annual incentives, and long-term incentive compensation opportunities are influenced by
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) the executives level of responsibility and function within the Company,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) the overall performance and profitability of the Company,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (c) our assessment of the competitive marketplace, including other peer companies, and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (d) the economic environment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our philosophy is to focus on total direct compensation opportunities through a mix of base salary, annual cash bonus and long-term incentives, including stock-based awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We also believe that the best way to directly align the interests of our executives with the interests of our shareholders is to make sure that our executives acquire and retain a significant level of stock ownership throughout their tenure with the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our compensation program pursues this objective in two ways: through our equity-based long-term incentive awards and our stock ownership guidelines for our senior executives, as described in more detail below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Overview of Executive Compensation Components
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Companys executive compensation program consists of several compensation elements, as described in the table below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pay Element   What the Pay Element is Designed to Reward   Objective of the Pay Element   Why We Choose to Pay Each Element Base Salary   Core competence in the executive role relative to skills, experience and contributions to the Company   Provide fixed compensation based on competitive market practice   Provide a standard element of competitive market pay Annual Cash Incentive   Contributions toward the Companys achievement of specified pre-tax profit goals, as well as achievement of revenue and asset management goals for certain NEOs      Provide focus on meeting critical annual goals that lead to our long-term success      Provide annual performance- based cash incentive compensation   Motivate achievement of critical annual performance metrics Long-Term Incentives   Stock Appreciation Rights (SARs):      Sustained stock price appreciation      Continued employment with the Company during a three-year vesting period   The combination of SARs and PRSUs provides a blended long- term focus on:      Sustained stock price performance      Achievement of pre-tax profitability targets      Executive ownership of our stock      Executive retention in a challenging business environment and competitive labor market   Align executives interests with those of shareholders and enhance their retention     Performance Restricted Stock Units (PRSUs):      Sustained pre-tax profitability (determines the number of PRSUs that are earned)      Focus on the Companys stock price performance      Continued employment with the Company during a four-year vesting period (five years including the performance year)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pay Element   What the Pay Element is Designed to Reward   Objective of the Pay Element   Why We Choose to Pay Each Element Retirement Benefits   Plans are described in detail later in this proxy statement under the heading Additional Information Regarding Executive Compensation   Executives are eligible to participate in employee benefit plans available to all employees as well as:      Tax Deferred Savings Plan: Rewards saving for retirement      Supplemental Retirement Plan (SRP): Rewards executives for continued employment in the same manner as other employees      Tax Deferred Savings Plan: Provide a voluntary tax-deferred retirement savings vehicle for our executive officers      SRP: Make total retirement benefits for our executive officers commensurate with those available to our other employees as a percentage of pay   Treat executives in the same manner as other employees by making them whole on amounts they would have been entitled to receive under retirement plans had the plans not been limited by the IRS Code Welfare Benefits      Executives participate in medical, health, life insurance and disability plans generally available to our employees      Continuation of welfare benefits may occur as part of severance upon certain terminations of employment   Provide health and welfare benefits to our employees that are competitive within the marketplace   These benefits are part of our broad-based total compensation program Additional Benefits and Perquisites      CEO/President/Chairman only: Board-mandated requirement that the corporate aircraft be used for personal travel      CEO/President/Chairman only: Selected club memberships   Neither item has a tax reimbursement provision   These pay elements facilitate certain Company objectives   Corporate aircraft use: Accommodate security, CEO/President/Chairman availability and efficiency concerns   Club memberships: Facilitate the CEO/President/Chairmans role as a Company representative in the community   Accomplish the specific objectives noted at left Change in Control and Termination Benefits   What is provided: We have change in control agreements with certain officers, including our named executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The agreements provide severance benefits if an officers employment is terminated within two years after a change in control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No excise tax gross-ups are provided   What it rewards: Continued employment in the event of an actual or threatened change in control   Retain executives and provide continuity of management in the event of an actual or threatened change in control   Maintain a stable executive organization in the face of the uncertainty of an actual or threatened change in control
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The use of these programs enables us to reinforce our pay for performance philosophy, as well as strengthen our ability to attract and retain highly qualified executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that this combination of programs provides an appropriate mix of fixed and variable pay, balances short-term operational performance with long-term shareholder value and encourages executive recruitment and retention.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Determination of Appropriate Pay Levels
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pay Philosophy and Competitive Standing
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In general, we target total compensation opportunities for our executive officers at or under the size-adjusted 50  percentile of the market data, including salary, target annual bonus, and long-term incentive opportunities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We provide somewhat conservative base salaries, higher-than-market target bonus opportunities and lower-than-50  percentile long-term incentives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: th th
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Determinations of one element of pay tend not to affect determinations of other pay elements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We also design our incentive plans to pay more or less than the target amount when performance is above or below target performance levels.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These grants align executive performance and achievement with shareholder interests.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SARs:    Each SAR represents the right to receive upon exercise an amount, payable in shares of common stock, equal to the excess, if any, of the fair market value of our common stock on the date of exercise over the base value of the grant.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Change in Control Arrangements
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company believes that severance protections, particularly in the context of a change in control transaction, can play a valuable role in attracting and retaining key executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accordingly, the Company has entered into change in control agreements with each of the named executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Information regarding these agreements and the benefits they provide is included in the Post Termination Payments and Benefits section of this Proxy Statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation, Nominating and Governance Committee evaluates the level of severance benefits to each such officer on a case-by-case basis, and in general, we consider these severance protections an important part of our executives compensation and consistent with competitive practices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that the potential occurrence of a change in control transaction would create uncertainty regarding the continued employment of our executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This uncertainty results from the fact that many change in control transactions result in significant organizational changes, particularly at the senior executive level.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In order to encourage our senior executive officers to remain employed with the Company during an important time when their prospects for continued employment are often uncertain, we provide our executive officers with severance benefits if the executives employment is terminated by the Company without cause or by the executive for good reason in connection with a change in control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Because we believe that a termination by the executive for good reason may be conceptually the same as a termination by the Company without cause, and because we believe that in the context of a change in control, potential acquirers would otherwise have an incentive to constructively terminate the executives employment to avoid paying severance, we believe it is appropriate to provide severance benefits in these circumstances.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The change-in-control agreements with our executives were amended in 2014 to eliminate all tax gross-ups with respect to excise taxes under Internal Revenue Code Section 4999 that may be due on such payments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the Company has in the past grossed- up additional SRP amounts for FICA taxes in the event of a change in control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The SRP was amended and restated January 1, 2009 to provide that no employees may commence participation in the plan on or after that date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As such, there are no further gross-ups other than to those individuals participating in the SRP prior to the January 1, 2009 freezing of the plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock Ownership Guidelines
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have adopted stock ownership guidelines for the named executive officers identified above and for other key executives designated by the Compensation, Nominating and Governance Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The ownership guidelines are reviewed at least annually by the Compensation, Nominating and Governance Committee, which also has the authority to evaluate whether exceptions should be made for any executive on whom the guidelines would impose a financial hardship.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The current guidelines as determined by the Committee include:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) CEO  ownership equal to seven times prior years salary; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) other covered executives  ownership equal to one to three times the prior years salary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The covered executives have a period of five years in which to satisfy the guidelines from the date of appointment to a qualifying position.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shares counted toward this requirement will be based on shares beneficially owned by such executive (as beneficial ownership is defined by the SECs rules and regulations) including PRSUs, but excluding unexercised options and measured against the average year-end stock price for the preceding three fiscal years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The guidelines also call for the covered executive to retain 50% of the net shares obtained through the exercise of options or when a restricted stock award vests for at least six months.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The covered executives are encouraged to retain stock ownership per the guidelines for a period of six months following the date of retirement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Impact of Accounting and Tax Treatments of Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The accounting and tax treatment of compensation generally has not been a factor in determining the amounts of compensation for our executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, the Committee and management have considered the accounting and tax impact of various program designs to balance the potential cost to the Company with the benefit/value to the executive.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With regard to IRS Code Section 162(m), it is the Committees intent to maximize deductibility of executive compensation while retaining some discretion needed to compensate executives in a manner commensurate with performance and the competitive landscape for executive talent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Annual Incentive Plan has been approved by shareholders and is designed to qualify as performance-based to be fully deductible by the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 2006 Long-Term Incentive Plan and the 2015 Incentive Plan are approved by shareholders
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: and permit the award of stock options, SARs and other performance-based equity awards that are fully deductible under Code Section 162(m).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Clawback Provision
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Since 2010, the Company has had a clawback provision in its Annual Incentive Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If at any time after payment of an executives bonus, the Company and its auditors determine that it was calculated on financial results that subsequently were restated or were otherwise based on incorrect data, the executive may be required to repay the unearned portion to the Company upon notice from the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Role of Executive Officers in Determining Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Executive Chairman and our Chief Executive Officer, with input from our Senior Vice President  Human Resources, recommend to the Compensation, Nominating, and Governance Committee base salary, target bonus levels, actual bonus payouts and long-term incentive grants for our senior officer group (other than themselves).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Gallagher and Mr. Donahue make these recommendations to the Committee based on data and analysis provided by our independent compensation consultant and qualitative judgments regarding individual performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Neither Mr. Gallagher nor Mr. Donahue are involved with any aspect of determining their own compensation.

sentences.text: The incremental cost to the Company of the personal use of company aircraft is calculated based on the average variable operating costs to the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Variable operating costs include fuel costs, mileage, maintenance, crew travel expenses, catering and other miscellaneous variable costs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The total annual variable costs are divided by the annual number of miles the Company aircraft flew to derive an average variable cost per mile.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This average variable cost per mile is then multiplied by the miles flown for personal use to derive the incremental cost.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The fixed costs that do not change based on usage, such as pilot salaries, the lease costs of the company aircraft, hangar
sentences.label: UNKNOWN
